title: The Death of Justice Antonin Scalia
description: The sudden death of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia has massive politics and policy ramifications this election year. NPR legal affairs correspondent Nina Totenberg joins host Tamara Keith to talk about them, along with justice correspondent Carrie Johnson and editor and correspondent Ron Elving.  Find the team on Twitter @NinaTotenberg, @tamarakeithNPR, @johnson_carrie, @NPRrelving, and at npr.org/politics — or email the show at nprpolitics@npr.org.
